content.title: Interest Subsidy on Loans for Agriculture and Allied Activities
content.beneficiary: Bonafide agriculturists, individuals of the animal husbandry sector, fisheries sector
content.details: Interest Subsidy on Loans for Agriculture and Allied Activities is a scheme by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa. Through this scheme, the bonafide agriculturist, individuals of the animal husbandry sector/ fisheries sector from Goa are provided a loan of upto ₹ 5,00,000 for the purpose of Agriculture and Allied Activities. The applications are accepted only in offline mode.
benefits: Interest Subsidy on Short-Term Loans: 4% to farmers who promptly repay their loans.

Interest Subsidy on Long-Term Loans: Equal to the difference between a 4% interest rate and the normal rate charged by eligible Banks, in line with their policies. The subsidy is subject to a maximum limit of 8%.
eligibility: For Inland Fisheries: The applicant should own or lease any of the fisheries-related activities, such as pond, tank, open water bodies, raceway, hatchery, rearing unit, possess the necessary license for fish farming and fishing-related activities, and any other state-specific fisheries and allied activities.
The applicant may include fishers, fish farmers (individual & groups/partners/share/croppers/tenants/farmers), self-help groups, joint liability groups, and women groups.

For Marine Fisheries: The applicant should own or lease a registered fishing vessel/boat, possess the necessary fishing license/permission for fishing in estuaries and sea, engage in fish farming/mariculture activities in estuaries and open sea, and participate in any other state-specific fisheries and allied activities.
content.application_process: Offline. The interested applicant should request the prescribed format of the application form from the department, fill in all mandatory fields, paste a passport-sized photograph, and submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the concerned authority at the Department of Fisheries.
documents_required: Letter From Bank to Avail Loan
Copy of Permission Letter Issued by Directorate of Fisheries to Construct Canoe/trawler/purseiner/purchase of New Net
Copy of Certificate Issued by Coastal Aquaculture Authority for Construction/renovation of Prawn Farming

faqs.question: What is the official website of the Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa?
faqs.answer: The official website is www.fisheries.goa.gov.in. For detailed guidelines, refer to https://fisheries.goa.gov.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/CitizenCharter-2.pdf.

faqs.question: Is there a specific format for the application form, and where can it be obtained?
faqs.answer: The interested applicant can obtain the prescribed format of the application form from the official website: https://fisheries.goa.gov.in/schemes-services/.

faqs.question: What are the contact details for the Directorate of Fisheries, Government of Goa?
faqs.answer: Contact the Directorate at Dayanand Bandodkar Marg, Panaji Goa. Tel: (O) 2224838, Tel: (Dir) 2227780; Email: dir-fish.goa@nic.in; Website: www.fisheries.goa.gov.in.

faqs.question: Are Persons with Disabilities (PwDs) eligible for this scheme, and are there specific criteria for them?
faqs.answer: Yes, PwDs are eligible, and there are no specific criteria mentioned for them under the 'Interest Subsidy on Loans' scheme.

faqs.question: What is the role of the Department's Grievance Redressal Officer, and how can complaints be lodged?
faqs.answer: The Officer addresses dissatisfaction or complaints; complaints can be lodged at dir-fish.goa@nic.in, with responses provided within 30 days.

faqs.question: Is there any age-related criteria for individuals applying for the 'Interest Subsidy on Loans' scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no age-related criteria for applicants under this scheme.

faqs.question: How is the interest subsidy on long-term loans calculated, and what is the maximum limit?
faqs.answer: The subsidy is the difference between a 4% interest rate and the normal rate charged by eligible banks, with a maximum limit of 8%.

faqs.question: Is there a specific deadline for submitting applications for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no deadline for submitting applications under the 'Interest Subsidy on Loans' scheme.

faqs.question: What is the application mode for the scheme, and is there any application fee?
faqs.answer: The application is offline, and there is no application fee for the 'Interest Subsidy on Loans' scheme.

faqs.question: Are self-help groups eligible for the scheme, and if so, what are the criteria?
faqs.answer: Yes, self-help groups are eligible, including fish farmers and women groups engaged in fisheries-related activities.

faqs.question: What is the criteria for eligibility in inland fisheries, specifically regarding ownership or leasing of fishing-related activities?
faqs.answer: Eligibility requires ownership or leasing of fisheries-related activities, possession of necessary licenses, and compliance with state-specific fisheries regulations.

faqs.question: Could you clarify the interest subsidy for prompt loan repayment in the short-term category?
faqs.answer: Farmers who promptly repay loans receive a 4% interest subsidy in the short-term category.

faqs.question: What is the maximum loan amount provided under the 'Interest Subsidy on Loans for Agriculture and Allied Activities' scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme offers loans up to ₹5,00,000 for individuals in the fisheries sector.
